page.title: 14Cricket Bat Manufacture
page.content: For twenty six years Mr. Bernie Facer has been making cricket bats, the last seven years in Buckden. The bats handles are made of maneau cane which comes in a long poles that have to be cut to length and split down the middle.A layer of rubber is layed on it and then a wedge of wood before the other half is layed on top and string wound around it. The blade is made from specially grown female willow.It has to be dried before being pressed under three tons of pressure to harden the wood. Before it is hardened it is easy to dent the blade with a hammer but afterwards the wood is not even marked. At the moment Mr. Facer is also making minature sets of stumps from the wood of a lime tree on the Kent County Cricket Ground.
